definition: to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)
to know/knowledge/Taiwan pr. [shi4]
to record/to write a footnote

sentences.english: Appreciation of your high talents and literary attainments.
sentences.chinese: 對你的出衆才華和文學造詣的賞識。

sentences.english: Being unappreciated by your boss could make it hard to do your work effectively.
sentences.chinese: 上司的不賞識會影響你的工作效率。

sentences.english: We all appreciate the fine girls bicycles.
sentences.chinese: 咱們騎着腳踏車一路賞識柳綠粉紅色。

sentences.english: Humility is a timeless virtue that's appreciated by everyone.
sentences.chinese: 謙遜是爲人人所賞識的永恆的美德。

sentences.english: Many great writers were not appreciated fully while they were alive.
sentences.chinese: 許多大作家在世時並沒有受到人們的充分賞識。

sentences.english: She didn't appreciate that her sudden appearance might not be appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 她沒有意識到她的突然出現可能不被賞識。

sentences.english: At Xixiu Beach you can enjoy the national sailing and windsurfing teams training on the sea.
sentences.chinese: 在西秀海灘，你能賞識國家帆板隊在海上的訓練。

sentences.english: Your sincerity will help to make people feel appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 你的誠意將有助於人們感到被賞識。

sentences.english: I've decided to learn photography in order that I may more instanceropridined recognize the instanceewouls of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我決斷學攝影以便更能玩賞賞識自然的美。

sentences.english: Soon he was caressed by his superiors.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就受到了上級的賞識。

sentences.english: Admonitionliang Bute dare say, by general recognition.
sentences.chinese: 良弼直言敢諫，深受將軍賞識。

sentences.english: As often as not, you'll be unrecognized for your performance.
sentences.chinese: 而且你還要經常面臨你的表現不被賞識的境遇。

sentences.english: Encouragement and delightful learning atmosphere are very important in my classroom.
sentences.chinese: 在我的教室裏，我注重賞識教育及愉快的學習氣氛。

sentences.english: It was the scene which had pleased the director at the rehearsal.
sentences.chinese: 這場戲在排演時曾大得導演的賞識。

sentences.english: Everyone appreciates what others bring to the table.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都賞識其他人拿出來的東西。

definition: to recommend sb/to give a referral
to love and respect/love and respect
to promote to a higher position
(lit.) to fix one's gaze on/(fig.) to show interest in/(favorable) attention/favor
talent/CL:份[fen4]
to enlighten/to explain (a text etc)/to stimulate (a mental attitude)/enlightenment/revelation/motivation
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
to praise/to acclaim/to commend/to compliment
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to surpass others/outstanding/(basketball, soccer etc) to get past an opponent
to get promoted (at work etc)/promotion
repeatedly/time and again
senior/older generation/precursor
brimming over with talent (esp. literary)/brilliant
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
